discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
R1-2-4 have no adjacency to R3-5 because no L1 adj between different areas, how is R6 receiving full routes from all routers to begin with? Am I missing something?
Summarization is done on border so B makes the most sense

choices.A: Configure all routers as Level 1/2 routers so that route summarization functions throughout the network.
choices.D: Configure router R1 to send only the default route to R2 and R4.
choices.B: Configure routers R3 and R5 to send summary routes to R6.
choices.C: Configure the Level 2 router R6 to manage summarization for the network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Yes. D is correct

questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing LFA FRR on PE routers to allow unicast traffic to rapidly converge around link or node failures. The engineer configured IS-IS on the newly deployed routers in the data center in the same exchange as other routers. Which additional action must the engineer take before configuring LFA on the PE routers?

choices.D: Configure the isis network point-to-point command on each router.
choices.A: Configure IP Cisco Express Forwarding on each router.
choices.B: Configure the isis network point-to-multipoint command on each router.

discussion.content:
Not clear what is needed here, to filter out 150.0.0.0 prefixes, or the other prefixes from AS 400, or all prefixes from AS 400.
B would be correct if configured on R3 towards R2 (^400$ means the routes are originating in AS 400, which should be a neighbor AS)

Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The engineering team noticed route disruptions when DSL subscriber 172.16.20.10 goes offline. In this service provider environment:

• The OSPF backbone area is configured to advertise loopback prefixes.
• The PE routers are running BGP-IPv4 address family in a BGP-free core topology.
• The DSL subscriber IP subnet 172.16.20.10/32 is redistributed in BGP on PE1.

Which configuration on PE1 resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Of course A

choices.C: Configure each interface as either Level 1 or Level 2 circuit type on router 1.
choices.A: Redistribute Level 2 prefixes into Level 1 on router 2.
choices.D: Configure the router as DIS for each of the interfaces on router 1.
choices.B: Disable advertisement of the default route on router 2.

comments.content: Hmnm, it didn't say that R1 should become a L1/L2 router but instead either a L1 or L2.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If we have more L1-L2 routers then "C" will not help. We should redistribute L2 prefixes to L1.
